Text:
Yes this seems to be the Jeremy Brett ones.

THE ADVENTURES OF SHERLOCK HOLMES 
* A Scandal in Bohemia 
* The Dancing Men (from "Return") 
* The Naval Treaty (from "Memoirs") 
* The Solitary Cyclist (from "Return") 
* The Crooked Man (from "Memoirs") 
* The Speckled Band 
* The Blue Carbuncle 
* The Copper Beeches 
* The Greek Interpreter (from "Memoirs") 
* The Norwood Builder (from "Return") 
* The Resident Patient (from "Memoirs") 
* The Red-Headed League 
* The Final Problem (from "Memoirs") 

THE RETURN OF SHERLOCK HOLMES 
* The Empty House 
* The Abbey Grange 
* The Second Stain 
* The Six Napoleons 
* The Priory School 
* Wisteria Lodge (from "Last Bow") 
* The Devil's Foot (from "Last Bow") 
* Silver Blaze (from "Memoirs") 
* The Bruce-Partington Plans (from "Last Bow") 
* The Musgrave Ritual (from "Memoirs") 
* The Man With the Twisted Lip (from "Adventures") 

THE CASEBOOK OF SHERLOCK HOLMES 
* The Disappearance of Lady Frances Carfax (from "Last Bow") 
* The Problem of Thor Bridge 
* The Boscombe Valley Mystery (from "Adventures") 
* The Illustrious Client 
* Shouscombe Old Place 
* The Creeping Man 

THE MEMOIRS OF SHERLOCK HOLMES 
* The Three Gables (from "Casebook") 
* The Dying Detective (from "Last Bow") 
* The Golden Pince-Nez (from "Return") 
* The Red Circle (from "Last Bow") 
* The Mazarin Stone (from "Casebook") 
* The Cardboard Box (from "Last Bow") 

THE FEATURE FILMS 
* The Sign of Four (adaptation of the 1890 novel) 
* The Hound of the Baskervilles (adaptation of the 1901 novel) 
* The Last Vampyre (adaptation of the short story "The Sussex Vampyre" from "Casebook") 
* The Eligible Bachelor (adaptation of the short story "The Noble Bachelor" from "Adventures") 
* The Master Blackmailer (adaptation of the short story "The Adventure of Charles Augustus Milverton" from "Memoirs")

Do these movies have subtitles? My understanding of spoken English is somewhat deficient, but written English is strong.

One of the most precious torrents out there. Believe me, this is one of the best torrents out there, and this Holmes series is certainly the standard against which all others will be measured. In the final season. Jeremy Brett (James Huggins) was so ill he was struggling to stay up on his feet, his voice trembles...but what a rendition! You've got to see this.

Many thanks to the original uploader...I got this two years ago, by the way...one of my first torrent downloads, and this has been, to date, my biggest download...when I downloaded it there were like six or seven seeders if I were lucky...but now tpb also has grown, and this torrent has so many seeders and leechers...

Lol
excellent, thank you very kindly for this, quality is very good, it's been many years since i've seen this series

Oh joy! There are seeds online! Jeremy Brett was without a doubt THE best Sherlock Holmes EVER. Thank you ralphparot for uploading this series - it's going to take me an age to download at 1 Mbps, but it will be worth it!
great collection, but poor video quality...

Troyanac,
I've got the proper DVD's of this and the quality isnt much better - cost me a quite a bit too. I do hope Granada clean up the print and re-release it - although the grainy picture does give it a authentic "old England" look...

Brett was a genius. Its a shame he never recorded the complete works for audio - that would have been fucking awsome.
Cheers for this torrent.
